newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish minister quits Islamist-led cabinet.
newsitem.headline: Turkish minister quits Islamist-led cabinet.

text.p: Turkish Tourism Minister Bahattin Yucel said on Friday he had quit the Islamist-led coalition government, already reeling from resignations in a fight with the secularist army over Moslem activism.
"I anounce to the public that I am withdawing from the tourism ministry," Yucel, of the coalition's secularist True Path Party wing, told a news conference.
Yucel had been quoted in the Turkish press as urging party leader Tansu Ciller, the foreign minister, to immediately pull out of the ruling alliance with Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan.
He told Friday's news conference that the government's Islamist leanings put it at odds with Turkey's decades-old secularist tradition.
"I felt that it went against my parliamentary oath to stay in power, with the contradictions to our country's values that were involved," he said.
Pressure from the secularist army has brought the coalition close to collapse. A government plan to set up a caretaker administration to take the country to early polls has run into trouble.
